mission: As a clinician-scientist, my high level career goal is to provide and improve the delivery of healthcare to my local community. I work on incorporating the latest innovations in intelligent systems to improve patient care. My current research exists at the intersection of AI safety and predicting outcomes in surgery and critical care, aiming to build models with a flexible understanding of risk.

Research Fellow.description: Postgraduate research in with Oxford Digital Health Labs (Nuffield Department of Women's and Reproductive Health)

Research Associate.description: Adjunct academic position with the Department of Surgery

Surgical Registrar.description: Rotations in General Surgery, Vascular Surgery, Orthopaedics, Plastic Surgery

Surgical Resident.description: Rotations in General Surgery and Cardiothoracic Surgery

Internship.description: Rotations in General Surgery, General Medicine, Emergency, and Orthopaedics

PhD.description:
Development of a novel machine learning approach and web application
(cardiac-ml.com) to predict and identify unique risk factors for
postoperative outcomes after cardiac surgery.

BSc (Hons).description:
Honours research year developing a novel transduction model for
testing lentiviral based gene therapy for cystic fibrosis lung
disease.

LLB (Hons).description: Honours degree with a thesis in medical law.

Diploma of Instrumental Music.description: Cello at the Elder Conservatorium of Music

research_summary.Areas of Interest: AI & Machine Learning, Dealing with Missing Data, Self-organisation, Cellular Automata.
